venue.name: Blackstone River Valley Bikeway @ The Blackstone River State Park

item.description:
I'll be up in Providence on Sunday (hint, hint) - might as well bring my bike along!

Join us as we travel through Rhode Island's most beautiful bike path on Sunday at 9:00 AM. Ride by water, greenery and scenic mills - all while in the company of one of the state's most famous bicyclists (me).

The Blackstone River Bikeway is 10 miles of paved bike path from Lincoln through Valley Falls Heritage Park in Cumberland and ends in Woonsocket at the Water Treatment Plant on Manville Hill Road.

Meet us at The Blackstone River State Park, Front Street, Lincoln. To find us: pull into the address listed above, go down the road for maybe a mile and we'll be at the first parking lot on your right.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for a guy on a red bike with a red car or try my cell: 401-699-7304
item.name: BIKING the Blackstone on Sunday!
